roleset.name: cause to die
roleset.note: MURDER-V NOTES: Frames file for 'murder' based on sentences in wsj. Verbnet entry 42.1, along with other assorted verbs of killing. (from murder.01-v predicate notes)
MURDER-N NOTES: Updated by Julia. Member of Vncls murder-42.1. (from murder.01-n)
MURDERED-J NOTES: Automatically created by Julia as an alias file for unification. (from murdered.01-j)

example.name: passive, no agent
example.text: To quote the highly regarded director of a privately funded drop-in center for the homeless in New York: ``If you're homeless, you-1 don't sleep for fear of *trace*-1 being robbed *trace*-1 or murdered.

example.name: agentive; true gerund!
example.text: For example, one of my favorite movies is the 1949 British comedy ``Kind Hearts and Coronets,'' in which the entire comedy is based on actor Dennis Price's murdering eight titled relatives (all played by Alec Guinness) because they snubbed his mother and stand in the way of his acquiring the family title.
example.arg: eight titled relatives (all played by Alec Guinness)
because they snubbed his mother and stand in the way of his acquiring the family title

example.name: with instrument
example.text: John-1 dreamed of *trace*-1 murdering Mary with nothing more than a plastic teaspoon, three pairs of pantyhose, and a live sea urchin.
example.arg: with nothing more than a plastic teaspoon, three pairs of pantyhose, and a live sea urchin

example.name: autogen1
example.text: murders by repeat offenders who torture their victims
example.arg: by repeat offenders who torture their victims

example.name: autogen2
example.text: the racial murder of a black teen-ager in the white Brooklynneighborhood of Bensonhurst
example.arg: in the white Brooklyn neighborhood of Bensonhurst

example.name: with MNR and arg1
example.text: the brutal murder of graduate student Imette St. Guillen
example.arg: of a graduate student Imette St. Guillen

example.name: with the candlestick
example.text: the axe murder of private eye Daniel Morgan in 1987
